lender.loan_because: Hi, I'm Jack and I love gardening. I own an online garden shop that sells every kind of garden product imaginable, at the best prices. lender.occupational_info: Hi, I'm Jack and I love gardening. I own an online garden shop that sells every kind of garden product imaginable, at the best prices. I'm passionate about what I do and I believe you should get the most for your money and the best for your garden.

lender.name: Philip
lender.loan_because: it is a good thing to do and it takes some of my frustration away about what is going on in the world...

lender.name: Bruce
lender.loan_because: I care

lender.name: Cathy
lender.loan_because: I believe micro-loans help people help themselves. They can help people not served well by large aid organizations.
lender.occupational_info: A former military attorney who has lived in Mexico several times and is making crafts to help children unable to live with their families

lender.name: Ruwangi
lender.loan_because: I strongly believe that unfortunate people around the world who are trying hard to make a decent living should get all the support they need to prosper.

lender.name: Corinne and family
lender.loan_because: I believe that all people should have as much control as possible over their own lives. Too many who live in disadvantaged countries have had their lives torn apart because of the policies of the IFIs and WTO, the complacency of UN member countries, and corporate and government corruption. As Mohammad Yunus has said, the problem is complex, the solution is simple. I cannot change the deeply entrenched, institutionalized and systemic problems - which need to be completely shifted - but I can help another women care for her family.
lender.occupational_info: I teach sociology at our university. One course I often teach is called "Social Control and Social Justice". I introduce students to the World Bank, IMF, and WTO and get them to understand the injustices put on developing countries. I then introduce them to the UN and NGOs - and show them the thousands that operate in Africa. We discuss the problems NGOs face and students compare their structure to the WB and IMF. Then, I introduce them to micro-financing, starting, of course, with Mohammad Yunus's Grameen. Then, I show them Kiva. They become VERY excited. They must choose a business that they would help if they could. They have to look up where they live and find out if the WB or IMF have implimented SAPs in that country - and if there are NGOs working in the country. They really get excited.

lender.name: marta
lender.loan_because: "You received without paying; give without pay." - Jesus

lender.name: Dragons
lender.occupation: We are students at Marshview Middle School

lender.name: Tamara
lender.loan_because: I can afford to, and I believe it will do good.
lender.occupational_info: I proofread textbook manuscripts prior to publication and distribution.

lender.name: Derick and Susan
lender.loan_because: Micro-loan programs such as those at Kiva have made it possible to reach out to so many people around the world who need assistance. We feel compelled to be part of that human chain of empowerment, and we admire the strength and courage of the entrepreneurs who seek the loans.
lender.occupational_info: Derick helps to develop new medicines. Susan volunteers for community organizations.

lender.name: Geoffrey
lender.loan_because: It is an interesting way to change the world.
lender.occupational_info: I write software programs to help businesses run more efficient and sell products over the Internet that ship to peoples homes.

lender.name: Daniel
lender.loan_because: Because I can.

lender.name: Teresa

lender.occupational_info: Everything and anything - oncall anytime :D

lender.name: Paul & Sara

lender.name: Joel

lender.name: Oscar
lender.loan_because: I can

lender.name: Karen
lender.loan_because: I love to! It's a wonderful way to help people who I otherwise wouldn't know anything about. I'd have no way to get much-needed resources to them. It's so easy - easy to use, easy to budget. Just $25 can make a big difference in someone's life. And it's lovely to feel so connected to someone across the world!

lender.loan_because: God has blessed me with enough resources to do so much more than survive. How else could I be responsible with what I've been given?
lender.occupational_info: I am a student studying Biomedical Engineering - trying to do my part to better things around here.

lender.name: Joel in Texas

lender.occupational_info: I am a member of a team of software developers maintaining a major software system used by the financial services company we work for.

lender.name: Girish
lender.loan_because: I was fortunate enough not have to face any hardships. I notice the hardships all around me.

lender.name: Craig & Mary
lender.loan_because: We admire these entrepreneurs around the world. Our faith calls us to serve others.
lender.occupational_info: Craig supports people who service generators. Mary counsels people who are going through changes in their lives or who have been hurt by others. She helps them adjust and be stronger. Together we have been involved in starting a non-profit that serves people with epilepsy.

lender.name: Martha
lender.loan_because: We are all one. And sharing makes me happy!
lender.occupational_info: I'm a writer and editor.

lender.name: Carson
lender.loan_because: If I can afford to pay more for car insurance than most people make in a year then I DEFINITELY have enough money to let someone borrow $25. I pay more than that each week for gas money.
lender.occupational_info: I work part-time in a large department store selling fine jewelry. I am also a full-time university student.

lender.name: Katharine
lender.loan_because: It's a simple but personal way to make a positive impact.
lender.occupational_info: I work to ensure clean water supplies.
